properties.name: 21 Club
properties.description: Posted by Ddotcom12 98 Turk Street, San Francisco, CAOne of my favorite dive bars in the city. Nothing trendy, very loud, good jukebox. An eclectic mix of people from locals to concert go-ers [it\'s across the street from the warfield]. Usually crowded but always fun. Somehow, and god love him, Frank always recognizes me and Josh and pours up a shot of Jager for free. Amazing.

properties.name: Aunt Charlie's Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Ddotcom12 133 Turk St, San Francisco, CASeedy tranny bar. When we walked in [mind-you it was at 1am] they were serving mayo-laden salads, buffet style. No bread, no crackers, just bowls of potato, tuna, and chicken salads...with a spoon. Drag shows 10pm Saturday nights.

properties.name: Club Sixty-Five
properties.description: Posted by Ddotcom12 65 taylor street, san francisco, caSkanky. Period.

properties.name: Deco
properties.description: Posted by Ddotcom12 510 Larkin Street, San Francisco, CADECO GAY, DECO GAY, DECO GAY....ALL THE WAY. Good drinks, DJs on some nights, piano bar on Saturday nights. Wasn\'t there long enough to give it a \'proper\' review. Will update soon.

properties.name: High Tide Cocktails
properties.description: Posted by Ddotcom12 600 Geary Street, San Francsico, CAThe picture behind the bar is totally worth the price of admission. That said, it costs nothing to get in. Oh, snap!

properties.name: Hole in the Wall Saloon
properties.description: Posted by Ddotcom12 289 8th Street, San Francisco, CA"Dark cramped gay techno punk bar with lots of clever blinking light technology in a burning man mad max blade runner liquid sky kind of way." ~ gil s. Pretty much sums it up.

properties.name: Jonell's Cocktail Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Ddotcom12 401 Ellis Street, San Francisco, CA, 94102Love this quote from Mike W "I\'d be hard pressed to find a worse place for a bar. The two blocks of Jones street on either side of Jonell\'s is possibly the worst stretch of sidewalk in the Tenderloin, boasting the highest density of panhandlers, junkies, and semiconscious derelicts per-block of any other stretch in the city. Think you\'re edgy cause you slum 16th and Mission on the weekends? Punk, you ain\'t shit till you\'ve partied at Jones & Ellis..." When I went there the bartender pulled out a bat and ran after the loitering masses in front of the bar. Al Green is on the jukebox though.

properties.name: Summer Place Cocktail Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Ddotcom12 801 Bush Street, San Francisco, CA"Count me as a fan, Summer Place. Your rocky facade, your smoking policy, your cold beers tapped by a sweet old lady, your jukebox full of seventies gems and your fireplace have all earned you a spot in my top dives." ~ quote from sunny d

properties.name: The Brown Jug Saloon
properties.description: Posted by Ddotcom12 496 Eddy street, san francsico, caYikes.

properties.name: The Owl Tree
properties.description: Posted by Ddotcom12 601 post street, san francsico, caOwned by C. Bobby who\'s often called the best bar tender in San Francisco. One bit of advice, do NOT ask him why he likes Owls so much.
